page.title: 05HOUSING:WILBERLEE & HILLTOP.
page.content: The housing pattern in this block is one of contrast.In 11 of the 12 kilometre-squares, the housing density is very light comprising of scattered, even isolated, properties.A partial exception to this pattern occurs in the south-east kilometre square covering the HillTop suburb of Slaithwaite where there are around 400 houses extending westwards along Longlands Road in a broad ribbon development.The majority of these properties are terraced houses with small gardens, built in the 1890's or early 1900's.There are a mixture of semi-detached and terraced houses on the Longlands Council Estate. In rural areas no new house building is permitted.Barn conversions and the renovation of farm property dating back to the late 1700's is allowed, if traditional stone and slate is used.
